#summary Human Nerves
[Home] -> [BiologicalLifeResearch] -> [HumanNerves]
----

This page is intended to list all nerves of biological human, which connect mind to human limbs and visceral organs.
Related findings are structured by other research themes.

<wiki:toc max_depth="3" />

= FUNCTIONAL CLASSIFICATION OF INNERVATION =

  * see http://musom.marshall.edu/anatomy/grosshom/z_cranerv1.html

*General Innervation ‑ like spinal cord*:
  * *GSE* (General Somatic Efferent) - motor to somatic voluntary skeletal muscles (derived from somites)
  * *GSA* (General Somatic Afferent) - sensory to skin, joints, muscle and tendon receptor endings, nasal and oral cavity
  * *GVE* (General Visceral Efferent) = Autonomic Efferents - motor to smooth muscles in general and smooth muscles of  skin (arrector pilae muscles) and blood vessels, secretomotor to glands
  * *GVA* (General Visceral Afferent) - sensory to gut and its derivatives, pharynx, blood vessels, glands and internal organs

*Special Innervation ‑ only found in head*:
  * *SSA* (Special Somatic  Afferent) - special senses of vision, auditory sensation and vestibular apparatus
  * *SVA* (Special Visceral Afferents) - chemical senses of taste and by analogy smell
  * *SVE* (Special Visceral Efferents) - motor to voluntary skeletal muscles derived from branchial arches (these muscles develop in association with pharynx, which is rostral end of gut and therefore visceral)

= SPINAL CORD CONNECTIVITY =

== SPINAL CORD NUCLEI ==

*outer:*
  * *Lateral Cervical Nucleus* (LCN) - lateral horn (low-threshold fast-conducting, tactile/pressure relay); sensory, spinocervical tract
  * *Lateral Spinal Nucleus* (LSN) - lateral horn (relay in unmyelinated pathways between the periphery and brain, intersegmental integrator); sensory, spinohypothalamic tract/spinosolitary tract

*sensory:*
  * *Marginal Nucleus*, Apex of Posterior Horn, Nucleus Posterpmarginalis (MN) - LI (non-modulatable pain and temperature sensations); sensory, dorsolateral fasciculus (neospinothalamic path); modulatory, dorsolateral fasciculus (lateral spinothalamic tract)/anterior spinothalamic (anterolateral) tract
  * *Substantia Gelatinosa* (SG) - LII (pain, temperature, 1-order of LSTT); sensory, lateral spinothalamic tract/anterior spinothalamic tract; modulatory, dorsolateral fasciculus
  * *Nucleus Proprius*, Main Sensory Nucleus, Proper Sensory Nucleus (NPR) - LIII,LIV (crude and pressure, 1-order of VSTT); sensory: spinotectal tract/spino-olivary tract/spinocervical tract
  * *Clarke's Nucleus*, Nucleus Dorsalis, Posterior Thoracic Nucleus, Clarke's Column, Intermediate Zone (CLN) - LV, LVI (secondary visceral afferents, proprioception, DSTT, VSTT): sensory, spinoreticular tract

*motor:*
  * *Central Nucleus*
   * *Central Cervical Nucleus* (CCN) - LVII (spinocerebellar sensory, relays neck proprioception to cerebellum, locomotion); sensory, spino-olivary tract/spinovestibular tract
   * *Centrobasalis Nucleus* (CBN) - LVII (spinocerebellar sensory, relays forelimb proprioception to cerebellum); sensory, rostral spinocerebellar tract
  * *Retroposterolateral Nucleus*, Retrodorsolateral Nucleus (RPL) - LVII (distal large motor neurons to small finger muscles); motor, lateral corticospinal tract/rubrospinal tract
  * *Ventrolateral Nucleus*, Anterolateral Nucleus (VLN) - LVIII (distal muscles of shoulder girdle, arm, hip, thigh); motor, lateral corticospinal tract/rubrospinal tract/lateral reticulospinal tract
  * *Posteromedial Nucleus*, Dorsomedial Nucleus (PMN) - LVIII (axial muscles alpha motor neurons, trunk flexors and extensors); motor, ventral corticospinal tract
  * *Posterolateral Nucleus*, Lateral Motor Nucleus, Dorsolateral Nucleus (PLN) - LIX (distal muscles of forearm, hand, leg, foot); motor, lateral corticospinal tract/rubrospinal tract/lateral vestibulospinal tract
  * *Medial Motor Nucleus*, Anteromedial Nucleus, Ventromedial Motor Nucleus (MMN) - LIX (axial muscles alpha motor neurons, trunk flexors and extensors); motor, ventral corticospinal tract/medial reticulospinal tract/olivospinal tract
  * *Spinal Accessory Nucleus* (SAN) - LIX (control neck to rotate head); motor, tectospinal tract/medial vestibulospinal tract

*autonomic:*
  * *Intermediolateral Nucleus*, Intermediolateral Cell Column (IML) - LVII (autonomic, visceral structures, sym, psym); modulatory, hypothalamospinal tract; sensory, dorsal spinocerebellar tract/ventral spinocerebellar tract
  * *Sacral Precerebellar Nucleus*, Sacral Parasympathetic Nucleus (SPN) - LVII; TBD
  * *Lumbosacral Nucleus* (LUS) - LIX; TBD
  * *Phrenic Nucleus* (PHN) - LIX; TBD
  * *Onuf's Nucleus* (ONN) - LIX; TBD
  * *Dorsal Commissural Nucleus* (DCN) - LX; TBD

== SPINAL CORD TRACTS ==

http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-OEVoQDbse4k/TaM9sATLSgI/AAAAAAAADco/z7ctc9G6X5o/s1600/Transcerse%2Bsection%2Bof%2Bthe%2BSpinal%2Bcord.png

*MIXED*:
   * *dorsolateral fasciculus (dorsolateral funiculus, dorsolateral/posterolateral tract, fasciculus of Lissauer, tract/zone of Lissauer)*: discriminative pain and temperature information (location, intensity and quality)
    * A-delta fast pain fibers of body to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to marginal nucleus (N2) to VPL (N3) (neospinothalamic path)
    * A-delta fast pain fibers of head and neck to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to marginal nucleus (N2) to VPM (N3) (neospinothalamic path)
    * PAG (N1) to RVM (raphe nucleus of medulla, gigantocellular reticular nucleus) (N2) to marginal nucleus (N3) (inhibit pain, serotonine)
    * VTA (N1) to substantia gelatinosa (N2) (inhibit pain, dopamine, reward, placebo)
    * locus ceruleus (N1) to intermediolateral nucleus (N2) (inhibit pain, norepinephrine - physiological responses to stress and panic)

*ASCENDING*:
  * *dorsal (posterior) column*: (well-localized fine touch and conscious proprioception)
   * *fasciculus cuneatus (tract of Burdach)*: A-beta, fine touch, fine pressure, vibration, and proprioception of arms to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to cuneate nucleus (N2) to TH.VPL (N3) to 3b cortex
   * *fasciculus gracilis (tract of Goll)*: A-beta, tactile and pressure receptors of thoracic and lower limbs to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to gracile nucleus (N2) to TH.VPL (N3) to 3b cortex
   * *spinohypothalamic tract*: A-delta,C fibers to dorsal root ganglia of several roots (N1) to lateral spinal nucleus (N2) to hypothalamus - lateral nucleus, dorsomedial nucleus, anterior nuclei (paraventrical,suprachiasmatic,supraoptic) (endocrine, motivational responses to stimuli)
  * *anterolateral system*:
   * *spinothalamic tract*:
    * *neospinothalamic (trigeminothalamic) tract*: 
     * head, face and intraoral structures nociceptors to trigeminal ganglion (N1) to spinal trigeminal nucleus (N2) to VPM (N3) to neocortex BA 1,2
     * nociceptors of cranial nerves 7,9,10 to trigeminal, jugular, nodose ganglia (N1) to spinal trigeminal nucleus (N2) to VPM (N3) to neocortex BA 1,2
     * C-fibers of face dull, burning pain, deep, aching pain, temperature and crude touch to principal trigeminal nucleus (N1) to spinal trigeminal nucleus (N2) to IL, parafasciculus and centromedian (N3) to neocortex BA 3
    * *paleospinothalamic tract*:
     * *lateral spinothalamic tract (LSTT)*: free nerve endings (pain and temperature, A-delta/C fibers) to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to substantia gelatinosa,specific (N2) to TH.VPL (N3)
     * *anterior spinothalamic (anterolateral) tract (ASTT)*: unmielynated slow C fibers, soft nocioceptive information, light touch Merkel's receptors to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to substantia gelatinosa (N2) to TH.VPL (N3)
   * *spinoreticular tract*: free nerve endings (crude touch, temperature, pain) to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to clarke's nucleus (N2) to:
    * medullary reticular formation (MBA.HM.RF.MED)
    * pontine reticular formation (HMA.HP.PRF.GCR,HP.PRF.PPRF,FBA.MM.CNF) (N3) to TH.IL,intramedian (N4)
   * *spinotectal tract*: free nerve endings (crude touch, temperature, pain) to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to nucleus proprius (N2) to superior colliculus (N3)
  * *spinocerebellar tracts*:
   * *dorsal spinocerebellar tract*: neuromuscular spindles and Golgi tendon organs (trunk and lower limb) to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to intramediolateral nucleus (N2) to (unilaterally) CR
   * *cuneocerebellar tract*: C1-C7,proprioceptive/fine touch/vibration to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to accessory cuneate nucleus (N2) to CR
   * *ventral spinocerebellar tract (Gower's tract)*: C8-L3,proprioceptive/fine touch/vibration (body, legs) to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to intramediolateral nucleus (N2) to (bilaterally in C8-L3) CR (to cortex and globose, emboliform nuclei)
   * *rostral spinocerebellar tract*: C8-L3,proprioceptive/fine touch/vibration (body, legs) to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to centrobasalis nucleus (N2) to CR (bilaterally)
  * *supplementary sensory tracts*: Golgi tendon organs dorsal root ganglia (N1)
   * *spino-olivary tract (Helweg's tract)*: proprioception information,cutaneous impulses from muscles and tendons to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to nucleus proprius,central cervical nucleus (N2) to inferior olivary nucleus (N3) to CR
   * *spinovestibular tract*: C1-C4,neuromuscular spindles and Golgi tendon organs to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to central cervical nucleus (N2) to vestibular nucleus
   * *spinosolitary tract*: C fibers to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to lateral spinal nucleus (N3) to solitary nucleus
   * *spinocervical tract*: lumbosacral A-delta fibers to dorsal root ganglia (N1) to nucleus proprius (N2) to lateral cervical nucleus (N3) to:
    * periaqueductal gray matter (PAG)
    * TH.VPL (N3) to neocortex

*DESCENDING*:
  * *corticospinal tracts*
   * *lateral corticospinal tract*: cortex BA 1-4,6 (N1) to
    * motoneurons of retroposterolateral nucleus (RPL) (N2) to distal limb muscles
    * motoneurons of posterolateral motor nucleus (PLN) (N2) to distal limb muscles
    * motoneurons of ventrolateral nucleus (VLN) (N2) to distal limb muscles
   * *ventral (anterior, medial) corticospinal tract* (direct pyramidal tract, anterior cerebrospinal fasciculus): cortex BA 1-4,6 (N1) to:
    * motoneurons of central nucleus (N2) to axial muscles
    * motoneurons of posteromedial nucleus (PMN) (N2) to axial muscles
    * motoneurons of medial motor nucleus (MMN) (N2) to axial muscles
  * *subconscious motor tracts*:
   * *reticulospinal tract*:
    * *lateral (pontine) reticulospinal tract*: caudal pontine reticular nucleus, oral pontine reticular nucleus (N1) to ventrolateral nucleus (N2) to distal muscles (exciting anti-gravity, extensor muscles)
    * *medial (medullary) reticulospinal tract*: medullary reticular formation,gigantocellular nucleus (N1) to medial motor nucleus (N2) to axial muscles (inhibiting excitatory axial extensor muscles of movement)
   * *tectospinal (colliculospinal) tract* (coordinate head, neck, and eye movements by visual and auditory stimuli): superior colliculus (N1) to spinal accessory nucleus (C1-C4) (N2) to axial muscles of neck
   * *rubrospinal tract*: red nucleus,magnocellular neurons (N1) to (mediation of voluntary movement by cerebelum):
    * motoneurons of retroposterolateral nucleus (RPL) (N2) to distal limb muscles
    * motoneurons of posterolateral motor nucleus (PLN) (N2) to distal limb muscles
    * motoneurons of ventrolateral nucleus (VLN) (N2) to distal limb muscles
   * *vestibulospinal tract*:
    * *lateral vestibulospinal tract*: lateral,inferior vestibular nucleus (N1) to posterolateral nucleus (N2) to arms, legs (modulates muscle tone to maintain equilibrium)
    * *medial vestibulospinal tract*: medial vestibular nucleus (N1) to spinal accessory nucleus (N2) to neck muscles (ensures neck and trunk movements coordinated with eye movements)
   * *olivospinal tract*: inferior olivary nucleus (N1) to medial motor nucleus (N2) to axial muscles (stretch reflex and the skeletal muscle tone)
   * *hypothalamospinal tract*: hypothalamus (N1) to intramediolateral nucleus (ciliospinal center,T1-T2) (N2) to sympathetic nuclei (N3)

*INTERSPINAL*:
  * substantia gelatinosa (interneurons) -> nucleus proprius
  * clarke's nucleus -> spinal interneurons
  * viscerosensory information -> intermediolateral nucleus (IML, preganglionic sympathetic neurons) -> white rami (sympathetic tract, preganglionic fibers)

== MULTI-CATEGORY NERVES ==

  * *nerve of pterygoid canal* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne174.htm NERVE OF THE PTERYGOID CANAL]; vidian nerve) ORIGIN={union of deep petrosal nerve and greater petrosal nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={pterygopalatine ganglion and branches}; MODALITY={parasympathetic and sympathetic}; FIBERS={sympathetic:see deep petrosal nerve (carotid nerve); parasympathetic: see greater petrosal nerve (facial nerve)}
  * *pterygopalatine nerves* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne150.htm NASAL BRANCHES OF PTERYGOPALATINE GANGLION]; sphenopalatine nerves) DISTRIBUTION={the two nerves which connect the maxillary nerve to the pterygopalatine GANGLION}; MODALITY={they are the sensory roots of the ganglion}; FIBERS={GSA:all maxillary sensory from pterygopalatine to trigeminal; GVE:great and deep petrosal to lacrimal gland}
<img src="http://www.dartmouth.edu/~humananatomy/figures/chapter_48/48-7_files/image002.jpg">
  * *vagus nerve*
   * *vagus nerve, anterior trunk* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne250.htm ANTERIOR VAGUS NERVE],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne261.htm LEFT BRANCH OF ANTERIOR VAGUS],[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne270.htm RIGHT BRANCH OF ANTERIOR VAGUS]; left); ORIGIN={consists primarily of fibers from the left vagus, but also contains a few fibers from the right vagus nerve}; DISTRIBUTION={contributes to the esophageal plexus}
   * *vagus nerve, posterior trunk* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne267.htm POSTERIOR VAGUS NERVE]; right); ORIGIN={branch of the vagus nerve, consists primarily of fibers from the right vagus, but also contains a few fibers from the left vagus}; DISTRIBUTION={contributes to the esophageal plexus}
  * *cardiac innervation* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne236.htm CAROTID PLEXUS], MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne254.htm CAROTID BODY PLEXUS])
  * *proper digital nerves of hand* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/properdigitalnerves.htm PROPER DIGITAL NERVES OF HAND])
